turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, this stupid smart thermostat is acting up again! It keeps setting the temperature to 85 degrees in the middle of the night. I've already tried resetting it like five times. What gives?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. I'm sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your smart thermostat. To help me troubleshoot this, could you please provide the model number and the current firmware version? You can usually find this information in the thermostat's settings menu or on a sticker on the back of the device.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, the model number is ST-7000 and the firmware is v2.3.1. But honestly, what I really want to know is why this keeps happening? Is this a known issue? I read some stuff online about a similar problem but nothing really conclusive.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for providing that information. While v2.3.1 wasn't flagged as having a *widespread* issue with incorrect temperature settings, there were a few isolated reports similar to yours. To prevent this, we can try to do a factory reset. Navigate to settings->advanced->factory reset. Please be aware this will erase all of your temperature preferences. Let me know if you have any issues
